00045 global_args_t global_args;
00046 int current_parse_file;

00054 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00055 {
00056         int num_types;
00057 
00058         printf("--------------------------------------------------------------------\n");
00059         printf("Welcome to ODIN II version 0.1 - the better High level synthesis tools++ targetting FPGAs (mainly VPR)\n");
00060         printf("Email: jamieson.peter@gmail.com and ken@unb.ca for support issues\n\n");
00061 
00062         /* get the command line options */
00063         get_options(argc, argv);
00064 
00065         /* read the confirguration file .. get options presets the config values just in case theyr'e not read in with config file */
00066         if (global_args.config_file != NULL)
00067         {
00068                 printf("Reading Configuration file\n");
00069                 read_config_file(global_args.config_file);
00070         }
00071 
00072         /* read the FPGA architecture file */
00073         if (global_args.arch_file != NULL)
00074         {
00075                 t_clocks ClockDetails = { 0 };
00076                 t_power PowerDetails = { 0 };
00077 
00078                 printf("Reading FPGA Architecture file\n");
00079 // PAJ          XmlReadArch(global_args.arch_file, FALSE, &Arch, &type_descriptors, &num_types);
00080                 XmlReadArch(global_args.arch_file, FALSE, &Arch, &type_descriptors, &num_types, &ClockDetails, &PowerDetails);
00081         }
00082 
00083         /* High level synthesis tool */
00084         do_high_level_synthesis();
00085 
00086         /* activation estimation tool */
00087         do_activation_estimation(num_types, type_descriptors);
00088 
00089         return 0;
00090 } 
00091 
00092 static const char *optString = "c:V:h:o:O:a:B:N:"; // list must end in ":"
00093 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00094  * (function: get_options)
00095  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00096 void get_options(int argc, char **argv)
00097 {
00098         int opt = 0;
00099 
00100         /* set up the global arguments to there defualts */
00101         global_args.config_file = NULL;
00102         global_args.verilog_file = NULL;
00103         global_args.output_file = "./default_out.blif";
00104         global_args.arch_file = NULL;
00105         global_args.activation_blif_file = NULL;
00106         global_args.activation_netlist_file = NULL;
00107 
00108         /* set up the gloabl configuration ahead of time */
00109         configuration.list_of_file_names = NULL;
00110         configuration.num_list_of_file_names = 0;
00111         configuration.output_type = "blif";
00112         configuration.output_ast_graphs = 0;
00113         configuration.output_netlist_graphs = 1;
00114         configuration.debug_output_path = ".";
00115 
00116         /* read in the option line */
00117         opt = getopt(argc, argv, optString);
00118         while(opt != -1) 
00119         {
00120                 switch(opt) 
00121                 {
00122                 /* arch file */
00123                 case 'a': 
00124                         global_args.arch_file = optarg;
00125                         break;
00126                 /* config file */
00127                 case 'c': 
00128                         global_args.config_file = optarg;
00129                         break;
00130                 case 'V': 
00131                         global_args.verilog_file = optarg;
00132                         break;
00133                 case 'o':
00134                 case 'O':
00135                         global_args.output_file = optarg;
00136                         break;
00137                 case 'B':
00138                         global_args.activation_blif_file = optarg;
00139                         break;
00140                 case 'N':
00141                         global_args.activation_netlist_file = optarg;
00142                         break;
00143                 case 'h':
00144                         printf("Usage: odin_II.exe\n\tOne of:\n\t\t-c <config_file_name.xml>\n\t\t-V <verilog_file_name.v>\n\tAlso options of:\n\t\t-o <output_path and file name>\n\t\t-a <architecture_file_in_VPR5.0_form>\n\t\t-A <blif_file_for_activation_estimation>\n\t\t \n");
00145                         exit(-1);
00146                         break;
00147                 default : 
00148                         printf("Usage: \"odin_II.exe -?\" for usage\n");
00149                         exit(-1);
00150                         break;
00151                 }
00152 
00153                 opt = getopt(argc, argv, optString);
00154         }
00155 
00156         if ((global_args.config_file == NULL) && (global_args.verilog_file == NULL) && 
00157                         ((global_args.activation_blif_file == NULL) || (global_args.activation_netlist_file == NULL)))
00158         {
00159                 printf("Error: must include either a activation blif and netlist file, a config file, or a verilog file\n");
00160                 exit(-1);
00161         }
00162         else if ((global_args.config_file != NULL) && ((global_args.verilog_file != NULL) || (global_args.activation_blif_file != NULL)))
00163         {
00164                 printf("Error: must include either a config file or comand line options...not both\n");
00165                 exit(-1);
00166         }
00167 }
00168 
00169 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00170  * (function: do_high_level_synthesis)
00171  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00172 void do_high_level_synthesis()
00173 {
00174         if (global_args.verilog_file == NULL)
00175                 return;
00176 
00177         printf("--------------------------------------------------------------------\n");
00178         printf("High-level synthesis Begin\n");
00179 
00180         /* Perform any initialization routines here */
00181         init_hard_multipliers();
00182 
00183         /* parse to abstract syntax tree */
00184         printf("Parser starting - we'll create an abstract syntax tree.  Note this tree can be viewed using GraphViz (see dosumentation)\n");
00185         parse_to_ast();
00186         /* Note that the entry point for ast optimzations is done per module with the function void next_parsed_verilog_file(ast_node_t *file_items_list) */
00187 
00188         /* Now that we have a parse tree (abstract syntax tree [ast]) of the Verilog we want to make into a netlist. */
00189         printf("Converting AST into a Netlist - Note this netlist can be viewed using GraphViz (see dosumentation)\n");
00190         create_netlist();
00191 
00192         check_netlist(verilog_netlist); // can't levelize yet since the large muxes can look like combinational loops when they're not
00193 
00194         /* point for all netlist optimizations. */
00195         printf("Performing Optimizations of the Netlist\n");
00196         netlist_optimizations_top(verilog_netlist);
00197 
00198         /* point where we convert netlist to FPGA or other hardware target compatible format */
00199         printf("Performing Partial Map to target device\n");
00200         partial_map_top(verilog_netlist);
00201 
00202         /* check for problems in the partial mapped netlist */
00203         /* this alos does unit delay for the netlist */
00204         printf("Check for liveness and combinational loops\n");
00205         levelize_and_check_for_combinational_loop_and_liveness(TRUE, verilog_netlist);
00206 
00207         /* point for outputs.  This includes soft and hard mapping all structures to the target format.  Some of these could be considred optimizations */
00208         printf("Outputting the netlist to the specified output format\n");
00209         output_top(verilog_netlist);
00210 
00211         printf("Successful High-level synthesis by Odin\n");
00212         printf("--------------------------------------------------------------------\n");
00213 }
00214 
00215 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00216  * (function: do_activation_estimation)
00217  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00218 void do_activation_estimation(
00219         int num_types,
00220         t_type_descriptor * type_descriptors)
00221 {
00222         netlist_t *blif_netlist;
00223         netlist_t *net_netlist;
00224         int lut_size;
00225 
00226         if ((global_args.activation_blif_file == NULL) || (global_args.activation_netlist_file == NULL) || (global_args.arch_file == NULL))
00227         {
00228                 return;
00229         }
00230         lut_size = type_descriptors[2].max_subblock_inputs;
00231 
00232         printf("--------------------------------------------------------------------\n");
00233         printf("Activation Estimation Begin\n");
00234 
00235         /* read in the blif file */
00236         printf("Reading blif format in for probability densitity estimation\n");
00237         blif_netlist = read_blif (global_args.activation_blif_file, lut_size);
00238 
00239         /* read in the blif file */
00240         /* IO type is known from read_arch library #define EMPTY_TYPE_INDEX 0 #define IO_TYPE_INDEX 1 */
00241         printf("Reading netlist format in for probability densitity estimation\n");
00242         net_netlist = read_netlist (global_args.activation_netlist_file, num_types, type_descriptors, &type_descriptors[1]);
00243 
00244         /* do activation estimation */
00245         activity_estimation(NULL, global_args.output_file, lut_size, blif_netlist, net_netlist);
00246 
00247         free_netlist(blif_netlist);
00248         free_netlist(net_netlist);
00249 
00250         printf("Successful Activation Estimation \n");
00251         printf("--------------------------------------------------------------------\n");
00252 }
